## a.

The goal of this task is to tell and explain what is the ratio used to evaluate whether to buy or lease an asset.

As we have learned in this section, when faced with the alternative of buying or leasing an asset, we use the Net Advantage to Leasing (NAL). This indicator is a measure of the savings of leasing versus buying.

The NAL is based on contrasting the net present value of the asset when leasing against the net present value of the asset when buying.

Now, ***why do we use the NAL for decision-making?*** It is a very popular indicator and we should not be surprised by this because the logic of its calculation is very obvious: ***compare the net present value in each scenario!***

## b.
The goal of this task is to explain how to perform an analysis of leasing or buying an asset;

The analysis we will want to do is comparative, so we will start with the following steps:

- Calculate the incremental aftertax cash flows for the lease scenario and also do it for the buy the asset scenario.

- Then, we will use the cash flows to calculate the aftertax interest rate on the lease.

- Finally, we will compare the ratio with the company's after-tax borrowing cost.
